metadata.title: CVE-2024-42299 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:fs/ntfs3: Update log->page_{mask,bits} if log->page_size changedIf an NTFS file system is mounted to another system with differentPAGE_SIZE from the original system, log->page_size will change inlog_replay(), but log->page_{mask,bits} don't change correspondingly.This will cause a panic because "u32 bytes = log->page_size - page_off"will get a negative value in the later read_log_page().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42299` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
